page.title: 05PRIDDY FAIR
page.content: For the last 600 years this fair has been held on Priddy Green. At the time of the Black Death in 1348 the market was moved from Wells. Ever since, in late August, a sheep market has been held. The hurdles which are used to make the sheep pens, are stored permanently on the green under a thatched roof. There is a placque to explain why they are there because many visitors stop and wonder what the curious building is. Today people come from all over the area to either sell or buy or just to visit this celebration of the past.
